SubSections.Title: Attributes
SubSections.Content: You can increase an attribute via an attribute increase by 1, up to a maximum equal to your [Attribute Maximum].

SubSections.Title: Move
SubSections.Content: You can spend up to [Speed] meters in total. You can spend 2 meters to move to a point that is close to your current location. Moving out of a tile that is difficult terrain requires spending 1 additional meter. You can only move into empty tiles. Additionally, you can spend 4 meters to start or stop being prone.

SubSections.Title: Plan
SubSections.Content: After 1 round, for 1 round, your next attack gains advantage.

SubSections.Title: Swap Weapon
SubSections.Content: You unequip up to 1 weapon and then equip up to 1 weapon either as a main weapon or as a support weapon. You can at most have 2 weapons equipped as main weapons and 1 more as a support weapon. A support weapon cannot be used to make any attacks except as mutations.

SubSections.Title: Spot
SubSections.Content: You uncover all hidden objects and combatants within 6 meters.

SubSections.Title: Pinpoint
SubSections.Content: You pinpoint the exact location of an object or combatant within range that you know the rough location of (within 10 meters).

SubSections.Title: Revive

Parts: You start your turn while dead.

SubSections.Content: You gain 1 doom. You revive with [Max Health -/ 10] health. You can choose to revive with full health instead at the cost of 1 additional doom. You can choose to reset all cooldowns and limits at the cost of 1 additional doom.

Parts: Describe what you want to do. The GM decides whether that requires an action

but it usually requires more than an existing ability of a similar power. The GM can optionally require an attack roll. The result is then determined by the GM at its discretion. Example things that you can do (with suggestions in brackets)

sneak (quick action, usually a roll), pick up or give item (quick action), jump (move action, usually no roll), throw stone (action, a roll), kick (action, a roll), analyze stats or ability (quick action, usually a roll), pull lever (quick action), open door (quick action), disarm trap (quick action), lockpick door (action, a roll), etc.

SubSections.Title: Dodge
SubSections.Content: Your evasion is increased by 2 against the attack.

SubSections.Title: Self Correction
SubSections.Content: You either increase or decrease the natural result by 1.

SubSections.Title: Subconscious Impulse
SubSections.Content: You use 1 reflex to regain a quick action, or 2 to regain an action. You can use a maximum of [Reflex] every 5 rounds.

SubSections.Title: Spend Luck
SubSections.Content: You roll a d20. You can choose to replace the result with the natural result of the attack.
